com.rohitkalhans.sedna.stage

Class EventDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rohitkalhans.sedna.stage.EventDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.jms.MessageListener

    public class EventDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.jms.MessageListener
    Standard Event dispatcher implementation. The event dispatcher listens to the the source queue and waits for events. For every event seen by it, it creates a Runnable instance using the EventHandlerTask and submits it to the thread-pool.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventDispatcher

        EventDispatcher(ThreadPoolConfig config,
               EventHandler handler,
               SedaQueue queue)
        Constructor to initialize the event dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        config - Config of the thread pool.
        handler - Event handler logic. Should ideally be provided while initializing the Stage.
        queue - The Source and the output queue. We will be using ActiveMQ which should have saperate virtual queues for input and output handling. see @link SedaQueue for more details.

    • Method Detail

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(javax.jms.Message message)
        The callback function that is called when an event is received by the input queue.
        Specified by:
        onMessage in interface javax.jms.MessageListener
        Parameters:
        message - The event will be passed to this method as Jmx message.

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Stops the Dispatcher. The threadpool will be shutdown.
